ItemBGDesc: A fleeting gleam arrowing across the night sky. Catch it before it's gone. Maybe it can be used to barter?\n\n"Some say that the lights are wishes of sentient beings. While insignificant and elusive, they did light up the pocket of sky around them, right?"

ItemDesc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
ItemBGDesc: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

Crystallized lights floating in the sea of stars, pulsing with the residual dream of an ancient Leviathan. Everything of the old world turned in the end into candlelight that illuminates the darkness ahead.

ItemDesc: Trailblaze Power will constantly regenerate at a rate of 1 point every 6 minutes to a max of 240 points. You may exchange Stellar Jade for Trailblaze Power.\nWhen Trailblaze Power has been fully regenerated or exceeds the maximum accumulation amount, it will no longer regenerate. At the same time, Reserved Trailblaze Power will begin to regenerate over time.
ItemBGDesc: The Imaginary power residing in the engines of the Astral Express that protects travelers on the Path of Trailblaze.\n\n"Explore, understand, establish, and connect — that is what it means to trailblaze. Akivili may have fallen, but their legacy continues!"

ItemDesc: When Trailblaze Power reaches or exceeds the max limit, Reserved Trailblaze Power will begin to regenerate over time. Reserved Trailblaze Power recovers 1 point every 18 minutes for a max of 2400 points.\nReserved Trailblaze Power can withdraw an equivalent amount of Trailblaze Power for a max of 240 points each time.
ItemBGDesc: Reserve resources for the Express that functions as a reliable safeguard for the trailblazing expedition.\n\n"Resource reserves. Hmm, do we have reserves of reserves? Such was {NICKNAME}'s question."

ItemDesc: The depths of memory, proof of growth.
ItemBGDesc: "I am not Fuli... I only believe in myself, for the path of immortality never ends."

ItemDesc: A measure of your Trailblaze Progress. Accumulate Trailblaze EXP to increase Trailblaze Level.
ItemBGDesc: "I came, I saw, I trailblazed."
N/A

ItemDesc: Permanently increase max Technique Points by 1.
ItemBGDesc:
The Relic of a Nameless. An item that might have been a pocket watch or a compass.
It is said that the first part to break was the chain. It suddenly snapped during a warp jump, the links scattering everywhere.
Then, it was the back. Hit by a lead bullet, it was on the verge of falling apart.
Lastly, it was the markings on the face. They were gradually worn flat over the long years, becoming no longer visible.
It broke countless times and underwent endless repairs. Its former shape was no longer discernible, and only the stilled sharp hands were pointing ever forward.

Take it, Legwork. It's yours now... Then, continue onward...

ItemDesc: Traces from a past journey. Accumulate this to progress on the Path of Return.
ItemBGDesc: Tracks left behind by the Nameless. Follow its guidance to find your way back to Trailblaze's star rail.

ItemDesc: A unique currency obtained through exploring Simulated Universe. Will be cleared after Simulated Universe is restarted.
ItemBGDesc: File fragments generated when the Simulated Universe is running. When they pile up, the performance of Simulated Universe will be significantly affected.\n\n"Sort them regularly. In return, the admin can perhaps change your stats every now and then."

ItemDesc: Indescribable materials used to unlock abilities in the Simulated Universe.
ItemBGDesc: A number you can accumulate or spend to strengthen Support systems in the Simulated Universe.\n\n"It even took Screwllum two system hours to develop an anti-cheat module."

ItemDesc: This item can be exchanged by spending 40 Trailblaze Power, and is used to exchange for Immersion Rewards in the Simulated Universe
ItemBGDesc: This digitized Trailblaze Power can only be used in the Simulated Universe.\n\n"Explore, understand, establish, and connect — that is what it means to trailblaze. Akivili may have fallen, but their legacy continues!"

ItemDesc: Every step of your journey leads to something bigger.
ItemBGDesc: "The definition of success is broader than conquering a formidable foe or touching the stars. Success is every time you achieve something you've never done before."

ItemDesc: Used to increase Nameless Honor levels.
ItemBGDesc: Accept the gifts of those who came before and begin your own trailblazing expedition.\n\n"Experience often comes at a cost, but that is why they are irreplaceable."

ItemDesc: The museum development fund issued by the Architects.
ItemBGDesc: As the museum continues to revitalize and improve, the Architects will issue a development budget for upgrading and recruiting staff, so that {NICKNAME} can better manage the various exhibit halls.
Astral Express Universal Pass. Travel as far as the Star Rail stretches.\n\n"Map worlds, meet people, make memories."

Direct ticket for the Astral Express with coordinates of specific worlds, suitable for passengers who just want to go from point A to point B.\n\n"Need to catch up with an old friend? Hop on and see the universe with him/her/it/them!"
N/A

ItemDesc: Item used to replenish Trailblaze Power. Provides 60 Trailblaze Power.
ItemBGDesc: Fuel canisters filled up with the dreams and courage of the Nameless.\n\n"Idealism? I prefer to call it the observer effect and human self-actualization."

ItemDesc: Experience material for characters. Provides 1000 Character EXP.
ItemBGDesc: A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.\n\n"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

ItemDesc: Experience material for characters. Provides 5000 Character EXP.
ItemBGDesc:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

ItemDesc: Experience material for characters. Provides 20,000 Character EXP.
ItemBGDesc:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 500 Light Cone EXP.
ItemBGDesc:
An imaginary substance that shouldn't exist in reality. The basic material to create Light Cones.
The images contained in the Light Cones become clearer when infused with this substance.

"I see, so this is the supposed 'memoria' of the Garden of Recollection. No wonder the Memokeepers can set off on galactic voyages with memories."

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 2000 Light Cone EXP.
ItemBGDesc: A can of Aether refined through special techniques.\n\n"Handle with care, do not drop or place pressure upon it. If damages and leaks occur, please refer to chapter II of the Leak Disaster Response Manual for emergency response."

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides 6000 Light Cone EXP.
ItemBGDesc: A canister of aether that has been extracted and distilled using special procedures.\n\n"The Garden looks forward to recreating a past glory, but it is a 'past glory' selected by them. Do you understand?"

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 100 Relic EXP.
ItemBGDesc: Lightdust permeated the Fragmentum, carrying what seems to indicate the existence of another civilization.\n\n"Theosophy holds that the database used to store information of the material world is called the Akasha Records. I don't necessarily support this, but... these dust indeed store information from the past. They are like... seeds? When you water them, they can yield bountiful fruit."

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 500 Relic EXP.
ItemBGDesc: Carefully collected Fragmentum dust with irregular shapes. Under the right conditions, they can express specific forms of relics.\n\nWhen the stars return to the right position... Ha! Just kidding.

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 1000 Relic EXP.
ItemBGDesc: A Fragmentum dust crystal that had densified after being reduced to its original form.\n\n"This must not be placed together with the ores offered to the Amber Lord. This is a creation of the Stellaron and goes against the will of Preservation."

ItemDesc: Enhancement material for Relics. Provides 2000 Relic EXP.
ItemBGDesc: A large Fragmentum dust crystal that had densified after being reduced to its original form.\n\n"It can even recreate our deceased mother if it has enough information! It really can! Even if it was only for 26 seconds... I just have one question after I completed the experiment: Just why was the Fragmentum created?"
Broken parts of a relic that are one step away from decomposing into the Lightdust floating in the Fragmentum.\n\n"Don't take them for mere scraps. I can restore them to their original state."

ItemDesc: Rare material used to custom-make Relics. It can model itself according to expectations.
ItemBGDesc: This unknown resin is as smooth to the touch as finely-grained dust. It seems to be from the Fragmentum, and has been shaped into the form of a wish by an invisible hand.\n\n"Based on the Guild's research, the Self-Modeling Resin may be the basis of the Fragmentum's capacity to replicate entities..."
Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.
Sighing embers formed when a shooting star fell from the sky.\n\n"At least they were once hot and bright."
Splendid gems formed when a shooting star fell from the sky.\n\n"Precious things stay precious."

ItemDesc: Used to exchange for rewards at the Light Cone Manifest shop.
ItemBGDesc: An afterimage of bygone days, invaluable to the Garden of Recollection.\n\nThe Garden of Recollection has its own rules: Exchange time for time and memory for memory. The Garden of Recollection can even bring back to you a lost, irrevocable past for the right cost...

ItemDesc: Used to exchange for rewards at the Jokes Come True shop.
ItemBGDesc:
In 2104 AE, Fomenko — a Candelagraphos scribe — obtained a mute parrot. She took great care of it, but it still only lived less than a decade. To commemorate her mute friend, Fomenko made quills out of the ten outermost feathers of the parrot's wings. One of these was for herself, while the other nine were stored in a vault.
She used her quills to annotate for an entire Amber Era, preserving vast swathes of ancient documents on the verge of being lost. At her funeral, her peers and students burst into tears because "a lamp that illuminated our cosmic past had been snuffed out."
It wasn't until people went over Fomenko's legacy that they finally realized that the scribe had been writing nothing but lies with her quills.

"Since the beginning of human history, the birds have been observing all the glory, folly, and glorious and foolish things humans have accomplished. The birds know. The birds take part. The birds remain silent."

ItemDesc: A special gadget made by Herta. It can Superimpose special Light Cones obtained from the Simulated Universe.
ItemBGDesc: A special gadget made by Herta. Its principles are not stated.\n\n"Be grateful, {NICKNAME}. I've prepared everything for you."

ItemDesc: A reward from the Simulated Universe. Can be used to buy items from Herta's Store.
ItemBGDesc: N/A

ItemDesc: Use to gain 60 Trailblaze Power and a 1:1 replica.
ItemBGDesc:
A blessing offered to those starting their journey.

May you embrace the skies and give the greetings of your first voyage to the endless starry seas.
May you cross the snowstorm and ignite an eternal flame at the end of the frigid winter.
The footsteps you leave behind will one day become a road upon which stars would shine.

A blessing offered to those starting their journey.

May you embrace the skies and give the greetings of your first voyage to the endless starry seas.
May you cross the snowstorm and ignite an eternal flame at the end of the frigid winter.
The footsteps you leave behind will one day become a road upon which stars would shine.

ItemName: Relic Coffret: Passerby of Wandering Cloud
ItemDesc: A device used to collect and restore the Lightdust in the Fragmentum to its original form. Use this to obtain a random 5-star relic from the Passerby of Wandering Cloud set.
ItemBGDesc:
You never know what's in the box until you open it.

"So it's essentially like buying a lottery ticket?"
"At least we don't need to worry about finding a cat that is both dead and alive."

ItemDesc: A device used to collect and restore the Lightdust in the Fragmentum to its original form. Use this to obtain a random 5-star relic from the Musketeer of Wild Wheat set.

ItemDesc: Artificial relics made by Herta in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Its data is sourced from the Simulated Universe.
ItemBGDesc: Artificial relics made in imitation to the principles behind the Fragmentum. Worlds that exist in theory are stored within spherical Planar Ornaments.\n\n"It's like a kind of Relic, but much bigger... and much more condensed."

ItemDesc: Virtual goods from Cosmic Warfare. Collect enough of them to receive rewards.
ItemBGDesc: N/A

ItemDesc: Necessary item for Encirclement. Consumes 1 each use and will regenerate over time.
ItemBGDesc: N/A

ItemDesc: Sealed thoughts and feelings. Can substitute Path Materials when they are insufficient. The substitution ratio of Tears of Dreams varies depending on the materials' rarity.
ItemBGDesc: The unresolved resentment, the unsolved puzzle, the places never reached, the achievements never attained... All the regrets that make the human soul bend its knees are sealed into these tears condensed by time. \n\n"Believe me, everything is possible in dreams..."

ItemDesc: Weapon fragments left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon rides on a scarlet horse to ignite cities, to take peace from humankind, and to bring down nations akin to anthills.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with driving peace out of nations."

ItemDesc: Weapon remnants left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
This brand represents their rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The master of this weapon carries a strong hatred for all sentient beings. They relish in the lament of intelligent beings as sweet melodies and topple civilizations with millennia of history in the blink of an eye.

"The bearer of this brand is tasked with stopping breath among the living."

ItemDesc: Broken weapon left behind by members of the Antimatter Legion. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
This weapon represents its owner's rank and accomplishments in the name of Destruction.
The owner of this weapon makes their appearance at the end of a war to fan the embers to consume the world. Regardless of the glories of the past or the blessing of its deities, this planet is destined to return to the ashes it came from, and to wither away in the depths of the starry sky.

The bearer of this brand is tasked with purifying the world.

ItemDesc: An arrowhead forged with Frost Steel by the craftsmen of Xianzhou. Used to level up Traces slightly for Hunt characters.
ItemBGDesc: A gift that parents give to their children who've successfully hunted their first prey at their coming of age ceremony. It is a blessing that their life would be as successful and true as an arrow heading towards its mark.\n\n"May the arrow on your waist and the sword in your sheath stay true and always find its target."

ItemDesc: An arrowhead forged with Stellaris Essence by the craftsmen of Xianzhou. Used to level up Traces moderately for Hunt characters.
ItemBGDesc: An arrow narrower than a finger's width. It can be loaded into an electromagnetic crossbow or a thermal seeking bow as ammunition. Its power is enough to penetrate the tough shells of abominations with just one strike.\n\n"The celestial banished arrives from afar, great distances journeyed 'twixt oceans of stars. Like rain falls a cloudburst of arrows below, in a helmet reflected the bright lunar glow."

ItemDesc: A shard of the Sky-Shattering Lux Arrow shot by the Reignbow Arbiter. Used to level up Traces significantly for Hunt characters.
ItemBGDesc:
The remains of a divine construct that ordinary humans can rarely behold. What kind of force can shatter stars that are light-years away? Humanity can only imagine the power of the Lux Arrow from the ashes it left behind.
Only the Furnace Master, chief of the Xianzhou artisans, has the rights to reforge the shards for those who are worthy.

"The death of a star shall shine bright for ages to come."

ItemDesc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the Meditative Scholars. Used to level up Traces slightly for Erudition characters.
ItemBGDesc:
It can unlock inspirations hidden deep within the conscience.
To take hold of the key is to grasp at the darting embers of thought that lead to the forward path.

"Eureka!"

ItemDesc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the sages of the worlds. Used to level up Traces moderately for Erudition characters.
ItemBGDesc:
It can unlock the mysteries binding the truth of the world and grants knowledge beyond the understanding of humans.
No matter how the wielder attempts to display their possession of the key, no one but themselves can see its form. Some people believe that to be a gift from the heavens, while others think it's a sign of mental disorder.

"I had a dream of molecules coiling up into a loop like a snake biting its own tail. I woke up realizing that this is the answer I've been looking for all along!"

ItemDesc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the greatest prodigies of the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Erudition characters.
ItemBGDesc:
This is the proof of invitation to the halls of the Nous Temple.
Finding the door of which this key opens is a far more arduous task than obtaining the key itself. Those who pass through the doors will immediately realize the impossibility of returning to this side.

"The Erudition does not have answers to the universe, but it will teach you how to ask the right questions."

ItemDesc: A crude but durable ancient hand-held bronze shield. Used to level up Traces slightly for Preservation characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Ancient legends entail a war where humans exhausted all primitive methods, following the gods into battle against overwhelmingly powerful beasts.
This shield is a witness to that war.

"There's no choice but to stop it, even if the efforts are futile."

ItemDesc: A shield forged with irreplaceable craftsmanship from an unknown alloy. Used to level up Traces moderately for Preservation characters.
ItemBGDesc:
It may be a large shield, but it feels as light as a feather. Even after taking on a full charge, no marks can be seen on the face of the shield.
Ancient legends tell of a war where high-spirited warriors wielded deathray-beaming spears and shields forged of Frost Steel, defended a nation destined to falter in the face of war.
This shield is a witness to that war.

"Powerful voices chant: 'The enemies are at our gates!'"

ItemDesc: An unusual shield embedded with ambers mined from beyond the skies. Used to level up Traces significantly for Preservation characters.
ItemBGDesc:
The wielder of this shield is seemingly protected by an invisible shield wall, immune to fiery arrows or mountainous claws.
Ancient legends entail a war where a tribal hero wielding a bronze shield charged to their death against a Leviathan, together with warriors armed with fiery spears.
This shield is a witness to that war.

"Do not cross the line."

ItemDesc: A fragment of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Nothing can prove its noumenon.
Touch gently to hear an unclear murmur from the shard.

"████ ██ █ █"

ItemDesc: A chunk of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc: No reflections can be seen on the surface of the black prism. Not only does it suck in all the light, it seems to also absorb the wielder's emotions, leaving only a faint feeling of emptiness.\n\n"..."

ItemDesc: A sizable piece of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc: The weak-minded and soft-willed will spend their eternity in chaos from just a simple glance into the prism.\n\n"         "

ItemDesc: A compact music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc:
It plays a relaxing and joyful tune.
Even through the simplistic tune, anyone with the slightest understanding of music can tell the mastery of the composer of the piece.

"Grab the hands of your Family and let us dance!"

ItemDesc: A music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc:
It plays a hymn sung by a small band.
It is impossible to find out to whom the lyric of the hymn sends its praise.

"Penury, trial of the Great One! Wealth, grace of the Great One!"

ItemDesc: A music box with complex structures made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc: It plays a powerful cosmic symphony.\n\n"Some astronomers believe that the revolutions of the heavenly spheres work the same as complex mechanical structures. The crystal clear and pleasant notes emitted during the movements of the stars are known as the 'Harmony of the Heavenly Spheres.'"

ItemDesc: A seed of blessing sown by the Aeon of Abundance. Used to level up Traces slightly for Abundance characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Those who come in contact with it are slowly healed of their wounds and illnesses.
People who pray for the blessing of life while in despair will always have their prayers answered.

"You shall be granted what you ask for."

ItemDesc: A young sprout emerging from the Seed of Abundance. Used to level up Traces moderately for Abundance characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Radiating warmth, life and growth flourish around the place where it sinks its roots. Barren wastelands turn into luscious grass fields, withered plants rejuvenate and blossom, and springs burst through the ground to moisten the land.
As you get closer to it, your muscles and bones twitch and propagate with an unbearable itch.

"Life is unfailing where the soul abounds."

ItemDesc: A gorgeous flower blooming from the Sprout of Life. Used to level up Traces significantly for Abundance characters.
ItemBGDesc:
The stamen contains the concentrated power of the Path of Abundance, ensuring the flower's ever-lasting vitality. No fire, ice, or any harshness can hinder the growth of this magnificent life form.
Given time, its leaves shall feed upon starlight. Its roots shall burrow into the flesh of every being of this world, all-connected, never-perishing. Its fruits shall fulfill the promise of immortality.

"There be giant ships, eclipsing mountains, drifting over the void. Upon them grows the undying tree. Its consumption grants immortality."

ItemDesc: Broken teeth fragments left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces slightly for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Borisins consider their teeth as a warrior's blade and weapon.
The Borisin worship warriors possessing supreme power. In their tribes, where the strong rule the weak, those with dental caries will only be discarded by the group.

"O, Brood Lord, grant us sharp teeth and claws."

ItemDesc: Blood-sucking sharp fangs left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces moderately for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Borisins consider their teeth as a warrior's blade and weapon.
A maddening impulse flows through the Borison blood. Fueled by Lupitoxin, they rend their enemies with their sawteeth and suck their blood, and are undefeated.

"O, Brood Lord, grant us steel skin and bones."

ItemDesc: Terrifying tusks left behind during the borisins' conquests. Used to level up Traces significantly for Destruction characters.
ItemBGDesc:
Borisins can further enhance their bodies through their innate "Moon Madness."
The battle-frenzied warriors exhibit incredible healing abilities, shedding the blood of their enemies in a sanguine mist together with the unbridled growth of their muscles and bones.

"O, Brood Lord, grant us divine strength."

ItemDesc: Feeble heliobus that scattered after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc:
An innocent, formless heliobus.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This little heliobus is innocent and naive and may be easily consumed by more powerful heliobi.

"Formless, rootless, and roaming boundless..."

ItemDesc: A mature heliobus that ran away after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc:
A mean and nasty heliobus that appears like a full flame.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This torch-like heliobus has just tasted consciousness and is eager to devour its host's emotions and desires.

"Absorb their emotions and sway their wills..."

ItemDesc: A beast-form heliobus that homogenized after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
ItemBGDesc:
An intelligent and powerful heliobus that has started to take the form of a beast.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. A large heliobus, having homogenized its numerous lesser peers, will gradually have a stable shape. These immortal beings can become so dangerous that they are considered calamities.

"Floods, fires, landslides, and thunderstorms..."

ItemDesc: Scattered note from the firmament. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc: A musical note scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the clouds, it blends into the symphony of mortal sounds, like a tear dissolving into the sea.\n\n"No one hears it until it dissolves into a song..."

ItemDesc: Melodious section fallen from the heavens. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc: A musical section scattered from order. Falling silently from the edge of the heavens, it blends into the cacophony, like grains of sand scattered in the desert.\n\n"No one notices it until it ignites a spark of inspiration..."

ItemDesc: Symphonic movements from the cosmos. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
ItemBGDesc: A piece of music scattered from order. It quietly echoes from beyond the heavens, drowned out by profound silence, like a lone star twinkling in a river of stars.\n\n"No one feels it until it is forgotten by all ♬..."

ItemDesc: A fathomless crystal. Ascension material for the Trailblazer.
ItemBGDesc: Severed from the highest of beings, this crystal reflects ever-changing mirages. The past and future intertwine on each of its countless facets, attempting to swallow up all observers.\n\n"Civilization is but a thin sheet of ice on top of the deep dark ocean of chaos."

ItemDesc: Fragmented saw teeth left behind by automatons. Can be used for the Ascension of Physical characters.
ItemBGDesc: It is said that the smelting techniques of the Architects allowed them to make chainsaws sturdy enough to split giant boulders. Such techniques have been long lost to history.\n\n"Boss Svarog says its blade is so thin that it can cut into the gap between molecules... What are molecules?"

ItemDesc: Hot, translucent substance almost like fire in the solid state. Can be used for the Ascension of Fire characters.
ItemBGDesc: Strange chitin peeled off from an interdimensional creature. Although not piping hot anymore, it still radiates warmth.\n\n"It's too cold outside. But with this gemstone on you, you'll be able to travel far and wide, even to search for cities with humans left..."

ItemDesc: Broken horn of a Frigid Prowler. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
ItemBGDesc: The Silvermane Guards would host contests where the winner must take a body part from a monster and bring it back within a set time limit. This cold broken horn must have been a trophy of one such contest.\n\n"Sir Bova, this is no moose horn and is certainly not fit for decoration above the Geomarrow furnace."

ItemName: Lightning Crown of the Past Shadow
ItemDesc: Headwear of the Guardian Shadows. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
ItemBGDesc: Accessory left behind by the shadow of a past Guardian, telling tales of the city of Everwinter.\n\n"Svetlana the Iron Fist — her wrath as terrifying as thunder and her retribution as swift as lightning."

ItemDesc: Arrows belonged to a Stormbringer. Can be used for the Ascension of Wind characters.
ItemBGDesc: Used to belong to a certain Fragmentum monster modeled after a certain kind of Voidrangers. An arrowhead can be barely seen buried in the center of the vortex.\n\n"Those who perish in the Fragmentum shall rise again where they met their demise."

ItemDesc: Horseshoe of a Voidranger: Trampler. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
ItemBGDesc: Rare horseshoe obtained when a Trampler of the Antimatter Legion is defeated. When no one is observing, it pops in and out of existence.\n\n"The name of the experiment? It's just called "Horseshoe of the Trampler"... "

ItemName: Golden Crown of the Past Shadow
ItemDesc: Headwear of the Decaying Shadow. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
ItemBGDesc: Accessory left behind by the shadow of a past Guardian, telling tales of the city of Everwinter.\n\n"Alina the Loving — her kindness as lofty as the sky and her compassion as brilliant as gold."

ItemDesc: The Aurumaton Spectral Envoy's weapon. Can be used for the Ascension of Physical characters.
ItemBGDesc: This is both a weapon used by the Ten-Lords Commission messengers to subdue mara and abominations, as well as a token they present when undertaking operations. No authorities of the mortal realm have jurisdiction over them.\n\n"Messengers of Netherworld, authorized envoys of death's realm. Bearing orders for apprehension, with no pardon for transgressors."

ItemDesc: The broken blade of a Searing Prowler. Can be used for the Ascension of Fire-Type characters.
ItemBGDesc: The Silvermane Guards would host contests where the winner must take a body part from a monster and bring it back within a set time limit. This broken blade must have been a trophy of one such contest.\n\n"I saw it with my own eyes. Captain Gepard smashed that thing's hot steel blade with one blow of his fist, then held it with his bare hands and plunged it into the belly of that cold fatty, warming its heart."

ItemDesc: Frosty chitin emitting a cold humming. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
ItemBGDesc: Strange chitin peeled off from an interdimensional creature. Although not freezing cold anymore, it remains trembling, absorbing heat from its surroundings.\n\n"How has no one thought of selling it to worlds where they don't have air conditioners? It works like an air conditioner and sounds as loud as one, too."

ItemDesc: A wooden staff with a pointed tip. It belonged to a shape shifter from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
ItemBGDesc: According to ancient Xianzhou records, those who have ascended can summon lightning and command the wind. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus claimed to have inherited the way of the gods. By demonstrating godly power, the disciples gathered large numbers of worshipers in secret. Branches of lightning coil around this wooden staff — could it be that the disciples were indeed no mere mortals?\n\n"The mortal body is but an illusion. Truth is only revealed to those who choose to ascend."

ItemDesc: Remains of The Ascended. Can be used for Ascension of Wind characters.
ItemBGDesc: The Ascended originally intended to bring the world a legacy of kindness, but as the bestowment of Abundance fades, understanding arrives alongside liberation: They were nothing more than a mortal with flesh and blood. Their ability to traverse the skies was nothing but an illusion, and all that remained of their existence was dust and dirt.\n\n"I curse ye, Reignbow Arbiter..."

ItemDesc: Remnant of an Abundance Sprite. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
ItemBGDesc: The distinction between "sprite" and "abomination" is merely a matter of name. A sprite is tamed and obedient, while an abomination is an uncontrolled misfortune. This nail embedded in the body of the Malefic Ape serves as an eternal guarantee of its status as a sprite.\n\n"As a disciple, it is your duty to obey. If the Master Primus drives this Possession Nail into your body, then you will have no choice but to obey, won't you?"

ItemDesc: Parts used in the Xianzhou ingenium technology. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
ItemBGDesc:
After Rubert unleashed the calamity of inorganic life, the aurumaton in Xianzhou also rebelled and began a ruthless slaughter. To ensure that the turmoil does not resurface, the craftsmen imposed imprisonment using talismans, stripping the aurumaton of their ability to think.

"What on earth did you do to make this fellow go mad?"
"I didn't do anything! I just... cleaned that golden talisman a bit."

ItemDesc: The fridge carried by Sweet Gorilla. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
ItemBGDesc:
A special SoulGlad fridge designed to preserve icy sweetness.
It serves as a tool for transporting drinks for the Sweet Dreams Troupe, and can also be wielded as a weapon when they are transformed into the Dreamjolt Troupe.

"Notice: The Sweet Dreams Troupe serves as an outsourcing company for transportation, and SoulGlad Enterprise does not bear any liability in the event of accidents."

ItemDesc: A flamer that instantly cooks food. Can be used for the Ascension of Quantum characters.
ItemBGDesc:
A special fiery dream flamer that uses flames to serve a delicious dream on the plate.
It serves as a tool for the Sweet Dreams Troupe's cooking, and can also be wielded as a weapon when they are transformed into the Dreamjolt Troupe.

"By design, the flames from this flamer affect only ingredients... although that doesn't exclude the possibility of the head chef regarding you as an ingredient."

The Leviathan's heart has stopped beating, but its mind lives on despite being trapped in a case. As long as the lid is closed, its mind is simultaneously both alive and dead, driving the engine of destruction.\n\n"Doomsday Beast, a blight made in the Warforge using what's left of a Leviathan and the weeping bones of thousands of the dead. It longs for the destruction of the universe and itself."

Together with this visor, the twisted wish of a Guardian also lies broken.
She had wanted to find a way out for her people to escape the Everwinter, but ended up becoming a puppet of a consciousness beyond her.

"Supreme Guardian, the title passed down to generations of Belobog's rulers, the one who looked after all the people — It never occurred to anyone that the Guardians themselves also long for care and protection."

No matter how many bodies it steals, its wish remains unfulfilled. Like those who seek the medicines of immortality, it craves an imperishable vessel, one that will rid it of its fear of destruction. And yet, it knows this is a dream that will never come true.\n\n"I have seen countless worlds devoured by The Blemished One's conflagration, and I was one of their flames. I danced at the twirl of their fingers, keenly aware that should the fuel burn out, this fire will also extinguish..."

ItemName: Past Evils of the Borehole Planet Disaster
ItemBGDesc: As a descendant bred personally by the Imperator Insectorum, its only desire is to expand the numbers of its kind. It uses giant scythes to harvest planets for its nest, tirelessly nurturing countless offspring, and devastating innumerable lives until the moment of its death.\n\n"On the broken planet, giant locusts blotted out the sky, and swarms of insects poured out of the planet's crust. The stag beetle raised this new nest and presented it as a gift to its Imperator Insectorum... May this horror only exist in historical records, never to appear again."

ItemDesc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
A heavy blow has caused this heart to stop beating and lose its luster.

"Preliminary tests indicate it's some kind of hybrid: one half is primordial, and the other half is something very similar to Stellarons." — Department of Biology, Sarah Castro

ItemDesc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is glimmering and the veins on it indicate it's still alive.

"What kind of monster is this? Did you see it... Its face! It has the face of our previous leader!"

ItemDesc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is pulsating slowly, with a residual force powerful enough to cause a new calamity. It's best to destroy it to prevent further troubles.

"It's like a cancer..."

ItemDesc: A small amount of anti-matter. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: A small amount of anti-matter that emanates out of the Voidranger: Reaver like the materialization of its destructive instinct.\n\n"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."

ItemDesc: A moderate amount of anti-matter. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: A moderate amount of anti-matter that floats around the Voidranger: Distorter. The amount of matter and anti-matter particles has reached a dangerous balance...\n\n"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."

ItemDesc: Condensed anti-matter. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Highly condensed anti-matter within the body of the Voidranger: Trampler. The moment of obliteration is the trumpet call for civilizations' destruction.\n\n"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."

ItemDesc: Pin badge worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: It is full of scratches from the erosion of wind and snow.\n\n"In ancient times, there was only one way Silvermane Guards could retire: death."

ItemDesc: Military rank insignia worn by captains of the Silvermane Guard. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Maybe it's a proof of heroics that you can brag about to your family. Maybe it's a lucky charm that protects you from a bullet.\n\n"Times have changed."

ItemDesc: Medal of honor worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards with gallant and meritorious service. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc:
A proof of honor awarded to those that fought against Fragmentum creatures, Underworlders, and sudden disasters.
It is not usually pinned onto the recipient's chest, but rather placed onto his coffin.

"Remember, young Gepard. It is not a toy: it is the destiny and blood of the Landau family."

ItemDesc: Mechanical part left behind from the Old World. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Despite its size, it was cast and polished in a way that people today would struggle to replicate.\n\n"A small screw in the Old World is stronger than our armor."

ItemDesc: Mechanical spindle left behind from the Old World. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Once taken apart, the precision components can never be put back together. Even the maintenance veterans in Belobog's Technology Division would think twice before touching it.\n\n"You idiot, the Bluecoats will only give you a few canned goods for this. Take it to Boss Svarog and you won't need to worry about food and clothing for a while."

ItemDesc: Mechanical engine left behind from the Old World. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: It uses Geomarrow as the energy source. When powered, it spews wandering auroras, not sparkles.\n\n"Only the Technology Division directly under the Supreme Guardian has access to information regarding the Old World. I lost my privileges after I was fired."

ItemDesc: New and young shoot budding from an ancient divine construct. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. Countless years ago, a sovereign's hubris for immortality caused the Xianzhou fleet to sail into the sea of outer space to seek divine recipes.\n\n"We desire to live for endless ages and maintain the empire for all eternity. Unfortunately, human lives have limits and human capacity has its ends. Thus, we send nine Navium Astriger to sail beyond the sky, seeking divine recipes for immortality."

ItemDesc: New flowers blooming out of an ancient divine construct. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After endless trials, the fleet seeking the medicine of immortality was able to behold the visage of the celestial being. The divine one cast down its blessings in material form, and the Ambrosial Arbor sprouted its leaves.\n\n"New buds descend into the moon, divine flowers bloom by the clouds. In the blink of a blossom's life, old wood returns to youthful grove."

ItemDesc: Deciduous twigs from an ancient divine construct. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: The source of the Xianzhou long-life species' "Endless Lifespan." The remnants of the Aeon of Abundance's influence. After the Three Sufferings, Xianzhou laid in devastation. The Homo celestinae fell as demons, and catastrophes occurred ceaselessly.\n\n"As decreed by the Ten-Lords Commission, all who are near the mara-struck state will be seized by the infernal judges and cast into the Shackling Prison."

ItemDesc: Components used in Xianzhou's ingenium creations. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc:
The foundation of Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The smallest constituent of all machine parts. Breaking it apart would be akin to destroying the cellular structure of a living being.

"The Intelligentsia Guild put up a bounty of two million credits for technical plans that can flawlessly disassemble Xianzhou mechanical puppets."
"If you know Screwllum, then these two millions are basically yours to take..."

ItemDesc: Parts of the Xianzhou machines. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: The connective components used in Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The intricate and thin teeth of the cogwheels are as minute as mustard seeds, and yet are interconnected to form a complex body, making the machine able to pass as true life.\n\n"Its form lies in harmony, a parallel to nature. Its movements cyclical, echoing the cosmos."

ItemDesc: Components used in Xianzhou's ingenium creations. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: The core of Xianzhou's ingenium technology. The armillary sphere roils and vibrates like the essence of a heart, making the machine think like a living being.\n\n"Do not be startled. Taking away its heart would make him... her?... No, make it lose its sentience and return to its mechanical sources."

ItemDesc: A storage device for Dreamscape creations. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: A storage device for broken dreams, providing a fundamental energy source for Dreamscape creations.\n\n"Install this device, and you will get a member of the Sweet Dreams Troupe."

ItemDesc: A control component for Dreamscape creations. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: A dream-building device that regulates desires and controls the Dreamscape creations' emotions.\n\n"If this device fails, you will get a member of the Dreamjolt Troupe."

ItemDesc: An energy core for Dreamscape creations. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: A dream-building device that constructs fantasies and grants souls to Dreamscape creations.\n\n"If this device malfunctions... try to wake up before you descend into a nightmare, my friend."

ItemDesc: A memoria fragment of fleeting thought. Crude material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Within the Memory Zone, thousands of thoughts flutter like dust. Broken thoughts accumulate, serving as nourishment and components for memes.\n\n"A fleeting thought may dissipate into thin air or amass into obsessions."

ItemDesc: A memoria fragment of profound impression. Normal material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Within the Memory Zone, the form memories float as fleeting glimmers of light, and only profound and memorable fragments can condense it crystals.\n\n"Memory is not a mere replication of past sensations, but a reconstruction of past impressions."

ItemDesc: A memoria fragment of obsessive desires. Advanced material used for enhancement.
ItemBGDesc: Within the Memory Zone, memoria of desires develops ceaselessly. It absorbs thoughts and impressions, nurtures magic mirrors of desires, and reflects the eerie shadows of memetic entities.\n\n"Memory points to the past, while desire points to the future. Seek desires from memory will cause dreams to become inverted, and inner demons will naturally be born."

ItemDesc: The cryptocurrency circulating internally in the Herta Space Station. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
ItemBGDesc: Hertareum was planned as a digital currency, but eventually settled as a physical currency.\nIt's worth mentioning that even though Hertareum coins don't contain any precious metal components, the high-definition silhouette Non-Fungible Token contained inside it is much more valuable than any of them.

ItemDesc: The official currency circulating in Belobog. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
ItemBGDesc: After a long era of blockades, the Overworld and Underworld denizens of Belobog have developed vastly different standards for currency.\nThe current exchange rate of shield to credits is now 1:50... Speaking of, why are credits still an official currency of Belobog? It seems people have already forgotten the answer to this question.

ItemDesc: The internal currency of the Xianzhou Alliance with strales as its basic monetary unit. Can be used to purchase goods in Special Stores.
ItemBGDesc: The Xianzhou strales has long been digitized before Xianzhou's interactions with the IPC ever happened. However, there are some collectors who still kept the Celest-Gold coins minted when the Alliance first came into existence. Shaped like the tip of an arrow or a narrow leaf, it seems to allude to the past and future of that civilization.

ItemDesc: This is said to be a commemorative currency issued personally by the Watchmaker. Can only be used at the Clockie Statue.
ItemBGDesc: A mysterious banknote, whose origin is unknown even to The Family. It features the classic image of Clockie on the front. This currency is prohibited for regular transactions in the Dreamscape world, and only a few people know its true purpose.

ItemDesc: A tasty and cheap Punklorde snack. Can be used to Superimpose the Light Cone "Before the Tutorial Mission Starts."
ItemBGDesc: A candy favored by a certain Stellaron Hunter. It contains rocket tree gum, and the crispy sound of bubbles popping is absolutely irresistible.\n\n"Pop!"

ItemDesc: The special talisman used by the Ten-Lords Commission to suppress heliobi. It can be used to superimpose the Light Cone "Hey, Over Here."
ItemBGDesc: "Decree of Nine Chapters, myriad spirits concealed."

A token for amusement facilities at Aideen Park. Despite their large size, they are exceptionally lightweight.\n\nQ: What is something that the more you possess, the less wealth you have? A: Gambler's chips.
In this grand universe, moral standards are materialized into physical form. Thumbs-up approvals aren't a rare sight to behold.\nWhat matters is that you are recognized!
An old coin from a time when metal was still a plentiful resource in Belobog.
Defective parts collected from a malfunctioning robot.\n\n"You get what you pay for. Obviously, this is worthless."
According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost.\n\n"A pickaxe with a polished point might make for a decent weapon?"
According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost.\n\n"An ordinary respirator."
According to Sampo, it's a piece of mining equipment that he lost.\n\n"Put it on and you'll be the finest in the mines."
A strange ornament you found in the Corridor of Fading Echoes resembling a delicate drill.\n\n"'Balakin' is inscribed onto the back. Your intuition tells you this device isn't something simple..."

An iron box passed down by the Balakin family, containing secrets left behind by their ancestors hundreds of years ago.\n\n"My ancestors left behind the iron box, but forgot to leave its key. Funny, very funny."

An encryption key used to activate the energy core in the restricted zone.\n\n"Despite its apparent similarities to other cores, it is clear the energy core inside the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone is highly-customized."
A custom key that can unlock the gear bridge inside the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone. Only officers are granted access permissions.

A temporary pass allowing entry into the Silvermane Guard Restricted Zone.\n\n"Temporary workers in possession of this temporary pass may enter the restricted zone within three hours. Lending this pass to others is a felony, and offenders will suffer serious consequences."
A part used to connect the body and chassis of a mine cart.\n\n"It is this small part that supports the entire structural integrity of the mine cart."

Level-1 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door.\n\n"Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

Level-2 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door.\n\n"Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

Level-3 certification for opening the entrance of the Robot Settlement. Only those who have obtained all three certification levels can gain permission to open the door.\n\n"Hey, ow! Ow, ow, ow... Can't this robot be more gentle with a pretty girl's hand?"

A Space Station Special Permit issued by Asta and Arlan. Allows you to freely enter and exit most cabins of the space station.\n\n"Why not all cabins you ask? Let's just say, researchers of Herta Space Station are all crouching tigers, I don't want to limit their imaginations when it comes to unlocking things."
A part used for connecting mine cart wheels.\n\n"A sturdy axle connects two mine cart wheels."
Proof of Julian's capacities.\n\n"There are no masters and newbies with marbles. Only those who grab the opportunities can win."
Treasure across time.\n\n"I didn't dig out ninety percent of the time capsules."
A key that can be used in the Rivet Town Commercial District.\n\n"The Fragmentum has come and everyone has fled. What Chamber of Commerce?"
A big bear doll that has been stashed away.\n\n"Natasha's hand-made bear doll. Admittedly, it is rather cute."
A map that supposedly leads to treasure.\n\n"A Treasure Map that looks rather sketchy. Is it... accurate?"
A map that supposedly leads to treasure.\n\n"A Treasure Map made a long time ago. Judging by how old it is, seems quite convincing."
Chitin that looks like armor, taken from a Fragmentum Monster.\n\n"Who wants something like this..."
A pamphlet about the used item auction.\n\n"A way for vagrants to trade... an auction sounds like a good idea."
A navigation map with "recipient address" marked on it.\n\n"Heron Express would like to warn you about the latest scam, 'We left your delivery at your door.'"

Intricate parts dotted around the Disposal Site. Hardly anyone would notice these dated-looking dull little things. Iron and nickel are gifts from the shooting star, but ultra nickel is something entirely different... Produced with mysterious methods, this superalloy, though outdated in the eyes of Herta, is patented and has no competition in the entire universe.\n\n"No competition? You get one of these for 10 credits on the black market. They say you can use it to repair all the beacons in the universe, very versatile."

A signal log in which is recorded the affirmative answer from Lesley and the truth about the starquake. It is sweet yet cruel.\n\n"Knowing how Rocky is, even I can't predict what he might do when he learns the truth."

A fake log with Lesley's answer. Whoever made this hopes to maintain the fragile balance of Rocky's life using abrupt rejection.\n\n"She will say no to him and his life will go on. It's always easier to forget than to heal."

A clip of the footage captured by the Herta Panopticon System. With all researchers under constant watch, there's no keeping secrets.\n\n"Surveillance is the bane of secrets but also the best historian-to-be. You can trace back to the beginning of everything, be it good or bad."

A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism.\n\n"As if you have fallen into a space that has neither beginning nor end, you look through a standard-issue navigation visor and stare into the deepest retreat of the vast universe. In the distance, you see a dim blue dot, like a drop of water before the canvas of darkness."

A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism.\n\n"That's the most direct evidence of the power of the Aeons. The justice people are seeking seems almost amusing in the face of a doomed planet... The hollow and eerily fast utterance is proof that the last bit of the videotape has been corrupted by something."

A videotape that recorded the intricate secrets of the space station. Its maker went the extra mile in making it secure by installing a most extraordinary security mechanism.\n\n"There are no reinforcements. If you can, please come back following the route we agreed on in advance. Do you copy? The intermittent sound from the cosmic radio is calling a name repeatedly. There is no reply."

An envelope found in Belobog.\nThe envelope reads: Dear kindhearted soul, can you buy me a stamp and post this for me? A thousand thanks!\nMaybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.
An envelope found in Belobog.\nThe envelope reads: To Carlo Eyre, Room B03, Building 35, 6th Street, Administrative District.\nMaybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

An envelope found in Belobog.\nThe envelope reads: To my one and only; my precious; my eternally youthful; my clever and witty; the one worthy of all my love to protect; the one who may not even exist: The true love of my future.\nMaybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.

An envelope found in Belobog.\nThe envelope reads: The trash I wrote should never see the light of day. That's fine, it can rot forever in the bottom of the dark mailbox.\nMaybe someone in the Overworld can help you with this unsent letter.
One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic.\n\n"Milk powder and a thermal baby bottle. Very thoughtful indeed..."
Anonymous package not yet delivered to the clinic.\n\n"Next to the anonymous package lies its sender."

A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "Thousand Stars."\n\n"Obviously this card was extremely valuable, but it was discarded like trash when someone lost interest... Sounds like something Herta would do."

A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "██." "When you run your fingers past the incomprehensible letters, you can't help but think: maybe this card is one of those collector's edition things. Could it be that having all the cards can grant you the power to summon... that Aeon?"

A mysterious card used to access an unknown facility. Its corner has been chipped away, and the letters on it have become unrecognizable. But when you hold it under the light at a certain angle, you can see the faint letters that read "Corporate."\n\n"Trust me, this is no doubt an access card used to open multiple layers of secured hatches, and it must have been developed by big corporations. The room it unlocks must also have been built by some pan-cosmic magnate."
A box of medical supplies urgently needed by Natasha.\n\n"Rubbing alcohol — hope it hasn't evaporated too much..."
A box of medical supplies urgently needed by Natasha.\n\n"Natasha's home-made painkillers. People faint just from the smell."
One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic.\n\n"Children fall asleep to stories. A must-try for young parents..."
One of the anonymous packages delivered to the clinic.\n\n"Soft and breathable, our quality clothing is designed to protect your baby from sweat. Perfect for silky-smooth skin."
Old letters that Kluzer carries around.\n\n"He didn't have the time to post them... maybe he didn't need to anymore..."

An old yellowing photo. Evidence of a certain individual's part in a certain historic event.
The figure in the picture did not seem to plan to let people feel the historical weight this photo should carry.

"What will become of Belobog in a hundred years? Well, you'll have to see it through your eyes."
Commodity contract for the auction. Use it to get paid based on the value of the goods.\n\n"They always put 'Handle with Care' on the contract but everyone ignores it."
Rare relic from ancient times. Can be used with intricate Old World instruments.\n\n"A way for vagrants to trade... an auction sounds like a good idea."

Letter from outer space by Hosea Lazaro the comet hunter — full of rubbish.\n\n"Back when I was still in the space station, I would look into the night sky in search of those faraway celestial bodies. Those clouds of stars, soft and alluring, captured my anxious heart. If you are like me, it's only a matter of time before people crown you with the title 'comet hunter'."

The Xenohydro was confined within a Mystic Case in the shape of a trapezohedron, with one of the planes made from the Absolutely Objective Lens. It is observed that the Xenohydro has icy blue skin that has silver spots dotted around. If you look through other planes to observe the Xenohydro, you'll find that it looks rather different. In fact, the image of the Xenohydro will vary from person to person.\n\n"I have a feeling that compared with the Xenohydro, this case is the actual curio. It can be worth quite a lot on the curio market."

The king of soft drinks, rough around the edges but good for your buddies — give 'em the strong kick they deserve.\n\n"A big barrel of pure caramel, a few jumping peas here and there, a handful of fresh canterbury bells, and some interdimensional leaves. Don't forget a drop of Ambergris of Abundance and a few rolls of orchid zest. How much of a kick you want is your choice."
A key with its teeth all worn smooth and not looking like it can open doors anytime soon.\n\n"Rivet Town Chamber of Commerce? Ask Julian if he knows about it."

A treasure map decoded with a Special Autoradiograph, revealing hidden coordinates within the space station.\n\n"I heard that scoundrel left behind some good stuff in the space station. This must be where the treasure is."

Bronya's toy as a child. The snowy owl circles above the snowfields, looking for the best opportunity to hunt the hare.\n\n"Even if our connection with the past is completely broken, there are still things that can complete us."
A very expensive flower. It blooms only once a year for a month.\n\n"But honestly, the price is completely worth that one month of bloom!"
An eight-petalled flower with white spots at each tip, just like snowflakes.\n\n"A long time ago, the initial snow of the year symbolized harvest and joy."
An aristocratic flower beloved by high society.\n\n"Rumor has it that a noblewoman spent her entire family's fortune on one of these flowers. This was why it was given the name Marquise."
A lovely small red-and-yellow flower that looks like the sun.\n\n"Just looking at it makes you feel warm inside."
Common mechanical parts used everywhere.\n\n"The prospectors say this is the specialty of corners and gaps. It kinda makes sense..."
A metal casing removed from discarded robots. Maybe it can still be used.\n\n"It's common for animals to molt, but have you seen robots molt?"
A cold metallic construct, but a burning passion perhaps hides beneath the petals.\n\n"It is cold to the touch, but warm if you put it against your body. Where on your body? Try your heart."
Portable backup power source for the elevator. Can be used in an emergency after being assembled.\n\n"Safety and portability are both great, but the capacity... who designed this!?"
A token required to cross an important location.
This seems to be a note that Mei had dropped. Messy writing fills the page with records on how to look after some common flower species.
This seems to be a note that Mei had dropped. Messy writing fills the page with records of what she had learned from other housekeepers.
Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the victim's jumbled statements.
Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the witness' jumbled statements.

ItemName: Testimony From the Suddenly Excited Man
ItemBGDesc: Testimony that Tantan had recorded at the scene of the incident. It is no simple task to get useful information out of the witness' jumbled statements.
A picture of the lane taken by the cycrane. Starskiffs fly to and fro within the lane. The offending starskiff tried to hide within the traffic, only to expose itself.
Handwritten cards with words of encouragement from Capote to his fans.\n\n"Master Capote's care and love for everyone is contained in these words!"
A photo snapped from a unique angle and contains Capote's autograph.\n\n"Master Capote authorized it! It's not an intrusion of privacy!"

The wiki-style encyclopedia that Capote's fans created themselves. Its contents mostly involve Capote's sayings.\n\n"Master Capote's keyword in life has been updated. The most recent version is: illumination!"
A personal special pass belonging to Arlan, with Peppy's photo stuck to it.\n\n"Brother is certainly loyal, and he carries his good friend's photo whenever he goes."
An alloy ceiling tile that is heavily damaged after a strong impact.\n\n"Will us Security Department have to... pay the bill for repairs?"
Arlan used too much force during combat and left a footprint on the floor tile.\n\n"We Security Department should use this as our insignia next year!"

A photo of Arlan's back as he heads to the suspicious crystal on his own to investigate. The determination in his steps is obvious.\n\n"Brother is definitely a bear amongst horses! His figure is so cool!"

ItemName: Dirty Ribbon Tied to a Bell
ItemBGDesc:
A white ribbon stained beyond recognition by an unknown filth.
A bell is pinned to the end of the delicate woven fabric, its chime guiding the blind girl through the darkness.

"That familiar, crisp chime... Big Sis, are you back..."

A small, handcrafted music box. Though kept under good care for many years, it has fallen into a state of disrepair.
The melody produced by the wooden box was somewhat unsettling, nonetheless, it was cherished by the two girls, who relied on each other like sisters.

"Welcome... home..."
A black envelope. A pitiful pin hangs on the spot where there should have been a fire lacquer seal. On the back is writing in large, crooked letters: "Invitation." \n\n"I see you're a chosen one..."
A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. Peak is its intended recipient.
A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. The rapper Eunice is its intended recipient.
A package not delivered by Wildfire in time. Its intended recipient could be one of the patients in the clinic.

Gaily wrapped gift. From the appearance, it can be seen that a lot of thought was spent on packaging this gift. \n\n"Giving disposable cutlery as a gift... You're implying that the recipient doesn't like to wash dishes."
A watch that was almost mistaken for a bomb. It was said that a person's prized accessories can reflect their taste to an extent.\n\n"So I offered up three mansions in exchange for his watch..."
A bouquet of fresh Ball Peony blossoms. In floriography, it means "patience."
A bunch of tiny Rainbow blossoms. In floriography, it means "the beauty of the ordinary."
A bouquet of fresh First Snow blossoms. In floriography, it means "purity and kindness."
A stalk of exquisite Marquise blossoms. It represents a status of prestige.
A letter from the Restricted Zone Logistics Officer Gilbert to his daughter Lila in the Overworld.
A badge representing justice. It might shed some light on this Disciple of Sanctus Medicus' social identity. If you flaunt it carelessly, you'll only invite unwanted ridicule to yourself.
A letter between the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. The correct words will only appear in the hands of the intended recipient.

A family photo taken somewhere not on the Xianzhou Luofu. Evidently, this Disciple of Sanctus Medicus came from a different world. He came here either chasing the distant idea of immortality or to cure a disease. He has a bright smile in the photo, drastically different to how he looked when you met him on the street.\n\n"We'll take another family photo together on the seaside rocks when you're back..."

A medical prescription. The messy writing makes one question the sanity of the author.\n\n"5 mace of Daiyu angelica, 3 mace of Tian Dong, mixed into the... of Xianzhou natives who have reached 600 years of age."
A standard package for delivery. It is tightly sealed and heading towards its recipient.
A polearm that was sliced in half. One can imagine the fate that befell its master.
A token required to traverse across an important location. Looks like the process of acquiring this token was not very smooth.
A grenade with its pin pulled. It is silent, as though it might start growling at any moment.\n\n"A little gift for the lost..."
A chip for regulating language mastery, especially for standard-issue Belobogian Automaton.
A piece of paper casually folded into a flower. The petals are delicate and life-like, and one wonders what kind of person would have bestowed such likenesses onto the paper.

This seems to be a page torn from a Department of Insight researcher's notebook. It is full of obscure and difficult symbols and sentences. There are cute cat stickers on the back of the page — the owner was probably a cat lover.\n\n"For Department of Insight internal use only. Do not leak out this document."

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — Table of Contents
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — Preface
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — "The Unexpected Parchment"
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — "The Missing Miner's Lamp"
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — "The Crates Are the Keys"
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — "Treasure Hunt on the Battlefield"
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

ItemName: The Adventurous Moles: Hidden Treasure — Postface
ItemBGDesc: A few pages from a children's adventure book very popular in Belobog.\n\n"The Moles, the Moles, are brilliant and strong! The Moles, the Moles, take the reins!"

An invitation for joining the Interastral Peace Corporation as a designer. Enthusiastic, cordial, with an astonishing salary offer.\n\n"Congratulations, Designer Ryan. We warmly invite you to join the IPC Technology Department."
Standard parts set from the Artisanship Commission used to assemble different aurumatons.\n\n"I've told you a hundred times before that we want to industrialize. In. Dus. Tri. Al. Ize!"
This boat Chengjie folded out of paper is like a tiny starskiff. Meticulously made and cute.\n\n"Master, I've finally graduated!"
A fist-sized geomarrow crystal, reflecting an indigo luster.\nThat supervisor Antonia probably knows how much it's worth.
A thermal mining pickaxe for Underworld miners. Often on-sold.\n80% new.
A thermal mining pickaxe for Underworld miners. Often on-sold.\n60% new.
Only the extremely lucky can get their hands on this crystal.\nIt doesn't look like it has any practical value, but it could be sold for a very good price.
A small part used for mechanical production. Smaller than a person's fist.\n"It is this small part that supports an avenger's moral cleanliness."
A rather artsy tin box sitting there silently like a book.\n"Please put this tin box on sale on the shelf on the second row to the right of Spare Time Book Shop's door..."

Mineral deposit formed by some kind of creature. Rumored to be pearls that solidified from drakons' tears, and is very popular among Outworlders who love such legends.\n"Drakons in the ancient sea, centuries long they may live. Tears shed dry into pearls, fat burns in lamps of old."

A Xianzhou-style scroll, on which Thousand-Handed Merciful Medicus' Salvation is written 500 times. Closer inspection reveals the last few hundred handwritings to be different from the first few hundred ones. Let's hope this doesn't get discovered.
An unsent letter addressed home. The author seems to have undergone some experimental "treatment."

A small nuclear weapon. Its countdown will begin automatically when it no longer detects the registrant's vital signs — In other words, you can't just throw it away.\n\n"Maybe we can chuck it in a lake somewhere..."
An access code provided by a weird person. Go to Starskiff Haven and give it to Ziqiao. Maybe you'll get a pleasant surprise.
A silly teacher forgot to wear clothes when he left in the morning. Go give him these clothes.
Everyone has a beating heart. Emotions are often more effective than logic when persuading someone.

ItemName: Research Records "Pretend to Be an Officer"
ItemBGDesc: The Realm-Keeping Commission require their officers to be upright, kind, just, industrious, and empathetic. Not many people in reality can tick all those boxes.
Ever seen a fist this big? It's all yours~
Any problem you can solve with money isn't a problem. It's a shame money isn't omnipotent.
Even those most skilled in lies and flattery often cannot resist the power of "sincerity."
March 7th brandishes this imaginary title page and decisively declares, "The passphrase is maybe — probably — definitely written on it!"

ItemName: Pharmacological Studies on the Draught of Draconic Surge
ItemBGDesc: A research report on the Draught of Draconic Surge written by Dan Shu, the Alchemy Commission's genius chief alchemist. Hurry and pass this to the Seat of Divine Foresight.

ItemName: A Medicine Concocted by Dan Shu
ItemBGDesc: A medicine Dan Shu concocted for a young patient. Its sweet smell is probably deliberate, made to entice the child to take their medicine properly.

Dan Shu said this medicine can invigorate the body and prolong one's life. She's the Alchemy Commission's chief alchemist and your close associate — You should be able to trust her and ingest this without issue.
The jade abacus accessory that Yanqing left behind while carrying out an operation. It records his activities, and was dropped at a timely moment to warn the Seat of Divine Foresight.
Messy writing that only a doctor can read.\n\n"This prescription can save people, but those who take it will hiccup uncontrollably every single day!"
A package containing the gift for Banxia, wrapped in fabric and tied up with twine.\n\n"I know she's busy... I wanted to give this to her personally, but now I have to ask you to deliver it to her."
A row of ready-to-eat raw frostweave salmon slices. The meat is firm and smooth and looks very tasty.\n\n"It's all thanks to the Eternal Freeze. We can eat raw fish from 700 years ago!"

A mimic snow slug, one of the components of the local biome out on the Belobog Snow Plains.
They can change their appearance to match the external environment and disguise themselves from their natural enemies.

"These slugs taste really good once they've been barbecued over a fire..."
A universal component in Belobog used to activate Geomarrow conduits.\n\n"Bro, you need to ask the real smart people. No one knows how to fix a machine better than Marev."

A cold platter made from air-fried preserved frostweave salmon and bread, with a bowl of redsunset jam for free.
Nowadays, frostweave salmon are mostly bred inside Belobog's walls. Their taste is miles off from the frostweave salmons fished from the wilds outside the city.

"I heard having raw fish slices together with bread can delay the onset of diarrhea effectively. Is that true?"
"Heck if I know. Go ask Natasha."

The steel skewer has all sorts of Belobog delicacies on it, and is barbecued thoroughly using high heat.
Its ingredients are mostly harmless. It is also the favorite food of Belobog's adventurers out in the wild, as well as being the most easily obtainable.

"This tastes so good! What kinds of meat are in it, though?"
"You wouldn't want to know."

The iron bucket contains all sorts of Belobog delicacies as a stew, and is simmered thoroughly using low heat.
Ingredients with outlandish appearances float in the soup, but it smells very delicious.

"What's wrong if they were once specimens? Aren't they dead animals and plants anyways?"

ItemName: Flash drive with a picture of Pela and her mother
ItemBGDesc:
A digital data storage component that has been frozen for more than a decade. It looks very primitive.
A young girl is being held by someone in the picture, but that someone's face is no longer distinguishable.

"Did you hear about that outstanding outdoors explorer who died 16 years ago? The best explorer out of all Belobog..."
A meteor fragment that bore witness to Belobog's 700 years of decline. It should be returned to the History and Culture Museum.
A lost roll of film. It should be returned to the History and Culture Museum.
Parts of the modern sculpture Gears and Wisdom that has been disassembled into countless tiny pieces. These parts have evidently been modified artistically and will not run as a machine.
N/A
An old photo revealing the location of the exhibit "Mechanism Energy Hub."
A treasure map revealing the location of the exhibit "Cannon."

ItemName: Treasure Map: Information Terminal and Display Monitor Set
ItemBGDesc: A treasure map revealing the location of the exhibit "Information Terminal and Display Monitor Set."
Qingni remembered how affectionate her mother was, but she also remembered how stubborn and unreasonable her mother was when it came to "becoming a pilot."

At the end of the Third Denizens of Abundance War, Reignbow Arbiter's Sky-Shattering Lux Arrow wiped out everything along the way. The Xianzhou people used the burning embers of the arrow to create many divine objects, and this is one of them. Yukong carries it with her, lest she forgets.\n\n"We were so happy then. I wish we could stay in those moments forever."
Jing Yuan still clearly remembers those two young pilots. They were optimistic, brave, and talented. But, he also remembers how it all ended.
Yukong hopes to still be that carefree Foxian girl, flying through the skies. But time will always pass by turbulently.
Caiyi hopes that her friend can take care of her daughter, and let her daughter be anything the child wants to be... Except a fighter pilot.

A Xianzhou medical compendium compiled by the Alchemy Commission. It includes prescriptions to many decoctions and have been listed in the Required Reading for New Recruits to the Alchemy Commission list.\n\n"Memorize these, you will be tested on them."
A branch that exudes an eerie aura, it is a rare ingredient in some prescriptions.\n\n"Does this... really have medicinal use?"
A lost and found notice for a missing ingenium.\n\n"I'm unsure of the exact time, but I lost a Baroumbrella ingenium that can write poetry near Synwood Pavilion in the Exalting Sanctum..."

A collection of poems left by a Vidyadhara poet from the Xianzhou Luofu that contains 523 untitled poems, and the themes are almost all about extremely mundane things.\n\n"To those who love poetry: Whoever does not talk about this collection is shallow and ignorant."
